sources.title: Prison Nurse
sources.description: Three young nurses volunteer to help in a state prison that has an outbreak of typhoid fever and get caught in an prison riot and break out.

sources.title: Prison Nurse
sources.description: Title: Prison Nurse Summary: A state prison is threatened by approaching floods, an epidemic of typhoid fever breaks out among the inmates, the prison's only doctor falls sick, there are only three nurses to administer... Directed by: James Cruze Actors: Henry Wilcoxon, Marian Marsh, Bernadene Hayes Production Company: Republic Pictures (I) Release Date: 1 March 1938 (USA) Aspect Ratio: 1.37 : 1 A state prison is threatened by approaching floods, an epidemic of typhoid fever breaks out among the inmates, the prison's only doctor falls sick, there are only three nurses to administer vaccines and take care of stricken patients--and a group of prisoners is planning to use the chaos as a cover for a mass escape.

sources.title: Prison Nurse (1938) CRIME DRAMA
sources.description:
Stars: Henry Wilcoxon, Marian Marsh, Bernadene Hayes 
Director: James Cruze

When a state prison is threatened by approaching floods and an epidemic of typhoid fever breaks out, a group of inmates plan to use the chaos as a cover for a mass escape!

metadata.Plot: A state prison is threatened by approaching floods, an epidemic of typhoid fever breaks out among the inmates, the prison's only doctor falls sick, there are only three nurses to administer vaccines and take care of stricken patients--and a group of prisoners is planning to use the chaos as a cover for a mass escape.
metadata.Writer: Earl Felton, Sidney Salkow, Adele Buffington
metadata.Actors: Henry Wilcoxon, Marian Marsh, Bernadene Hayes
